label: Behavior 35764555
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route forms a small elliptical pattern, approximated by a parametric equation of a circle with radius ~20 meters: lat(t) ≈ 55.7118 + 0.00005 × sin(2πt), lon(t) ≈ 10.97063 + 0.00003 × cos(2πt), where t ∈ [0,1] represents normalized time over the loop; this reflects the vessel turning in place or adjusting position within a confined harbor area, likely during docking preparation or anchoring
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 0.1 and 0.3 knots, indicating minimal propulsion changes)
Course change: fluctuating (the COG varies significantly from 6.0° to 212.0°, showing repeated directional changes over time)
Heading fluctuation: stable (the heading remains within a narrow range of 273°–282°, changing gradually by 1–2° per report, suggesting controlled yaw adjustments)
